meanings.definition: To stir up or provoke again.
meanings.sent1: The coach tried to reincite the team's spirit before the big game.
meanings.sent2: The speaker's powerful words were able to reincite the crowd's enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The magician's failed trick only served to reincite the audience's laughter.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist in the movie managed to reincite my interest in the story.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked cookies can reincite memories of childhood happiness.

meanings.definition: To rouse to action or renewed activity.
meanings.sent1: The inspiring speech managed to reincite the students to work harder.
meanings.sent2: The alarm clock's loud sound can reincite you to get out of bed in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The smell of coffee in the morning always helps to reincite my energy levels.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful sunrise over the mountains can reincite a sense of wonder and awe.
meanings.sent5: The sound of rain on the roof can reincite feelings of coziness and relaxation.
